GT.content: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border
GT.linkedContent: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border

GT.content: gift overruns border & suspends its relation to border, is beyond transgression
GT.linkedContent: gift overruns border & suspends its relation to border, is beyond transgression

GT.content: “another border already divided itself in indefinite abyssal supplements”

A.content: a line (police) line must be indivisible = identity, when line is divided, as it is by its 1<sup><small>st</small></sup> tracings, it splits in two > there is a problem (shield) as soon as the being one-self of anything is divided (intrinsic division)
A.linkedContent: a line (police) line must be indivisible = identity, when line is divided, as it is by its 1st tracings, it splits in two > there is a problem (shield) as soon as the being one-self of anything is divided (intrinsic division)

A.content: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility
A.linkedContent: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility

MC.content: “my clinamen has to do w/ the divisibility of the mark”
MC.linkedContent: “my clinamen has to do w/ the divisibility of the mark”

SEC.content: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [cf. LI pp. 30-1]
SEC.linkedContent: for Derrida, for a signature to function, to be legible, it must detach itself from present and singular intention of its production; its sameness alters its identity and singularity, dividing the seal [cf. LI pp. 30-1]

PAS.content: Blanchot: summons to cross the uncrossable has already crossed the line
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: summons to cross the uncrossable has already crossed the line

S.content: fire-writing, flame writes, writes itself, right in the flame (à même la flamme) > a Riss, frayage of this trait, a mark that leads spirit on the way to soul, pursues soul in way opened by its fire, trait de conflagration, l’esprit en-flamme—trace la route, il fraye la voie
S.linkedContent: fire-writing, flame writes, writes itself, right in the flame (à même la flamme) > a Riss, frayage of this trait, a mark that leads spirit on the way to soul, pursues soul in way opened by its fire, trait de conflagration, l’esprit en-flamme—trace la route, il fraye la voie

S.content: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness
S.linkedContent: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness

S.content: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides
S.linkedContent: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides

S.content: acc. Heidegger, difference or duality inscribed by the trait (Riss) is not division, it is the gathering (Versammlung) of the place (Ort), the de-cease (Abgeschiedenheit), in the one (Ein), the soul Gemüt, Ein Geschlecht, none other than Geist [path-breaking (frayage) of trait]
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, difference or duality inscribed by the trait (Riss) is not division, it is the gathering (Versammlung) of the place (Ort), the de-cease (Abgeschiedenheit), in the one (Ein), the soul Gemüt, Ein Geschlecht, none other than Geist [path-breaking (frayage) of trait]

DS.content: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write
DS.linkedContent: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write

ROP.content: Derrida agrees w/ Lacan that there is one libido (via Freud), it is the question of reason, principle of reason > d'un trait tiré de la raison ou d'une traite tirée [check drawn] sur la raison
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida agrees w/ Lacan that there is one libido (via Freud), it is the question of reason, principle of reason > d'un trait tiré de la raison ou d'une traite tirée [check drawn] sur la raison

ROP.content: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit

OTO.content: discourse on life/death occurs btwn logos and gramme, analogy & program, program & reproduction (since life is on the line, the trait [splitting of line] relating graphical to logical, also working btwn biological & biographical, thanatological & thanatographical)
OTO.linkedContent: discourse on life/death occurs btwn logos and gramme, analogy & program, program & reproduction (since life is on the line, the trait [splitting of line] relating graphical to logical, also working btwn biological & biographical, thanatological & thanatographical)

FS.content: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia
FS.linkedContent: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia

TB.content: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name
TB.linkedContent: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name

TB.content: Benjamin uses metaphor of amphora, ammetaphor, to describe contact btwn languages; metamphora adjoins along broken line (not infinite/straight line): Derrida compares to Heidegger, Rilke, Hölderlin’s urn (re: word/thing) > amphora is one w/ itself while its openness forbids its totality, always giving/receiving [open square]
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin uses metaphor of amphora, ammetaphor, to describe contact btwn languages; metamphora adjoins along broken line (not infinite/straight line): Derrida compares to Heidegger, Rilke, Hölderlin’s urn (re: word/thing) > amphora is one w/ itself while its openness forbids its totality, always giving/receiving [open square]

REST.content: [re: Shapiro/Heidegger correspondence] reciprocal legitimation, effects of a common code, mutual desire for truth: the 2 parts of the pair (identity & difference, total identity in concept or formal semantics, difference and non-overlap in directionality of traits)
REST.linkedContent: [re: Shapiro/Heidegger correspondence] reciprocal legitimation, effects of a common code, mutual desire for truth: the 2 parts of the pair (identity & difference, total identity in concept or formal semantics, difference and non-overlap in directionality of traits)

REST.content: line of detachment, the out-of-use, not only the one giving form to the shoes, there’s the line of the work qua picture in frame > frame makes a supplementary désoeuvrement, cuts out but also sews back together (invisible lace which pierces the canvas, like pointure)
REST.linkedContent: line of detachment, the out-of-use, not only the one giving form to the shoes, there’s the line of the work qua picture in frame > frame makes a supplementary désoeuvrement, cuts out but also sews back together (invisible lace which pierces the canvas, like pointure)

REST.content: crossing (over) certain lines, certain traits, like being in Heidegger’s Seinsfrage, or crossing the lines in a painting, or the lines of framing; at what moment do we (did Heidegger?) transgress these lines (traits), cross them? transgressing which law?
REST.linkedContent: crossing (over) certain lines, certain traits, like being in Heidegger’s Seinsfrage, or crossing the lines in a painting, or the lines of framing; at what moment do we (did Heidegger?) transgress these lines (traits), cross them? transgressing which law?

REST.content: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal
REST.linkedContent: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal

REST.content: acc. Heidegger, uselessness of what a painting represents and uselessness in that the painting represents, uselessness due to product’s (shoes’) detachment from milieu by the artifice of its reattachment: the line of the frame
REST.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, uselessness of what a painting represents and uselessness in that the painting represents, uselessness due to product’s (shoes’) detachment from milieu by the artifice of its reattachment: the line of the frame

REST.content: lace traits form the “frame” of the picture which appeared to frame them [i.e. the traits of the shoes draw out “this is a picture”] > we, the shoes, are bigger than the frame & incorporated signature
REST.linkedContent: lace traits form the “frame” of the picture which appeared to frame them [i.e. the traits of the shoes draw out “this is a picture”] > we, the shoes, are bigger than the frame & incorporated signature

REST.content: traits delimiting object & frame disqualify a priori by stricture/interlacing the question re: whether painting is required for a further step in thought
REST.linkedContent: traits delimiting object & frame disqualify a priori by stricture/interlacing the question re: whether painting is required for a further step in thought

REST.content: Verlässlichkeit is not natural, comes from the combat btwn earth & world, and its trait, other threads in Heidegger too: Ring, Geviert (fourfold), Gering (circuit)
REST.linkedContent: Verlässlichkeit is not natural, comes from the combat btwn earth & world, and its trait, other threads in Heidegger too: Ring, Geviert (fourfold), Gering (circuit)

RM.content: metaphor withdraws, it gets by w/out everything, withdraws at instant it overflows every limit, marking w/ supplementary trait one more turn, re-turn, re-tracing or retreat (re-trait)
RM.linkedContent: metaphor withdraws, it gets by w/out everything, withdraws at instant it overflows every limit, marking w/ supplementary trait one more turn, re-turn, re-tracing or retreat (re-trait)

RM.content: epoch of metaphor: suspensive retrait and return supported by line (trait) delimiting a contour
RM.linkedContent: epoch of metaphor: suspensive retrait and return supported by line (trait) delimiting a contour

RM.content: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait
RM.linkedContent: Verhüllung (veiling), Verborgenheit (being-hidden), Being withholds (se retient), withdraws (se retire) (sich entzieht), retrait

RM.content: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such
RM.linkedContent: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such

RM.content: metaphysics as tropics, corresponds to an essential withdrawal of Being > Being, the metaphor of metaphor (quasi-metaphor), overload of a supplementary trait, fold: re-trait
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics as tropics, corresponds to an essential withdrawal of Being > Being, the metaphor of metaphor (quasi-metaphor), overload of a supplementary trait, fold: re-trait

RM.content: re-trait of metaphor > gives rise to an abyssal generalization of metaphor > trait has internal multiplicity, la structure pliée-repliée d’un re-trait > opens out the borders or invaginates them
RM.linkedContent: re-trait of metaphor > gives rise to an abyssal generalization of metaphor > trait has internal multiplicity, la structure pliée-repliée d’un re-trait > opens out the borders or invaginates them

RM.content: for Heidegger, most grave and engraving signature of decision engages/allies 2 families in German language: 1. Ziehen (Zug, Bezug, Gezüge, durchziehen, entziehen) 2. Reissen (Riss, Aufriss, Umriss, Grundriss, etc.)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, most grave and engraving signature of decision engages/allies 2 families in German language: 1. Ziehen (Zug, Bezug, Gezüge, durchziehen, entziehen) 2. Reissen (Riss, Aufriss, Umriss, Grundriss, etc.)

RM.content: trait (that plural word): possibility of language, logos, lexis, inscription
RM.linkedContent: trait (that plural word): possibility of language, logos, lexis, inscription

RM.content: trait of recoupe [Bezug] (btwn Dichten/Denken) belongs to neither, not a common trait, concept, metaphor > if trait could be something, we might call it the unique seal of their alliance, but it’s never fully originary nor, as a path-breaking (frayage), is it fully derivative: makes way for naming thus not nameable, il n’a pas d’approchant en tant que tel
RM.linkedContent: trait of recoupe [Bezug] (btwn Dichten/Denken) belongs to neither, not a common trait, concept, metaphor > if trait could be something, we might call it the unique seal of their alliance, but it’s never fully originary nor, as a path-breaking (frayage), is it fully derivative: makes way for naming thus not nameable, il n’a pas d’approchant en tant que tel

RM.content: Riss, tracement de frayage, incises, tears; Heidegger names “Mark,” “march,” as limit, Grenz-
RM.linkedContent: Riss, tracement de frayage, incises, tears; Heidegger names “Mark,” “march,” as limit, Grenz-

RM.content: entame (breach/broach incision) best approaches translation of Aufriss (rift-design), le trait (Riss) d’une entame, d’une ouverture traçante, frayante, a non-voluntary decision > other French translations of Aufriss: gravure (engraving), tracé-ouvrant (opening sketch)
RM.linkedContent: entame (breach/broach incision) best approaches translation of Aufriss (rift-design), le trait (Riss) d’une entame, d’une ouverture traçante, frayante, a non-voluntary decision > other French translations of Aufriss: gravure (engraving), tracé-ouvrant (opening sketch)

RM.content: entamées, les deux parallèles se coupent à l’infini, se recoupent, s’entaillent: each one [Denken and Dichten] signs in some way in the body of the other, the one in the place (au lieu) of the other: sign there the contract w/out contract of their neighborhood
RM.linkedContent: entamées, les deux parallèles se coupent à l’infini, se recoupent, s’entaillent: each one [Denken and Dichten] signs in some way in the body of the other, the one in the place (au lieu) of the other: sign there the contract w/out contract of their neighborhood

RM.content: the trait of l’entame (breaching-broaching incision) marks Ereignis as propriation, event of propriation (not an originary instance prior/proper to the 2 qu’il entame et allie) ——via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality
RM.linkedContent: the trait of l’entame (breaching-broaching incision) marks Ereignis as propriation, event of propriation (not an originary instance prior/proper to the 2 qu’il entame et allie) ——via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality

RM.content: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace
RM.linkedContent: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace

RM.content: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même
RM.linkedContent: metaphysical unity of opposition determined only “starting from (à partir de)” the re-trait of the trait > the “starting from” s’y abîme lui-même

RM.content: repetition of incision stated violently in Riss, Ent-Ziehung, Ent-fernung, and in the Enteignen (rectraction of propriety) that hollows out every Ereignis ——performative of Heidegger’s writing of Aufriss (entame) > decree to name what’s still unknown under its name > Aufriss calls to us
RM.linkedContent: repetition of incision stated violently in Riss, Ent-Ziehung, Ent-fernung, and in the Enteignen (rectraction of propriety) that hollows out every Ereignis ——performative of Heidegger’s writing of Aufriss (entame) > decree to name what’s still unknown under its name > Aufriss calls to us

RM.content: Heidegger: the unity of the being of Sprache shall be called Aufriss
RM.linkedContent: Heidegger: the unity of the being of Sprache shall be called Aufriss

RM.content: Heidegger: Riss is the same word as marking (ritzen)
RM.linkedContent: Heidegger: Riss is the same word as marking (ritzen)

RM.content: Aufriss joins (articulates, spaces, holds together) the opening of Sprache ——incision remains veiled, trait of incision is veiled, withdrawn
RM.linkedContent: Aufriss joins (articulates, spaces, holds together) the opening of Sprache ——incision remains veiled, trait of incision is veiled, withdrawn

RM.content: le trait, il arrive à s’effacer dans un autre, reinscribing itself heterologically, allegorically
RM.linkedContent: le trait, il arrive à s’effacer dans un autre, reinscribing itself heterologically, allegorically

RM.content: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt ——Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)
RM.linkedContent: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt ——Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)

RM.content: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)
RM.linkedContent: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)

RM.content: Heidegger’s crossing of Ziehen w/ Reissen first occurs in “Origin of the Work of Art”: Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss ——for Heidegger, trait does not split adverse sides—attracts adversity toward unity of a contour (Umriss), a frame, a framework
RM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s crossing of Ziehen w/ Reissen first occurs in “Origin of the Work of Art”: Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss ——for Heidegger, trait does not split adverse sides—attracts adversity toward unity of a contour (Umriss), a frame, a framework

RM.content: Ge-stell of the Gestalt in the joining (Gefüge) of which “der Riss sich fügt”
RM.linkedContent: Ge-stell of the Gestalt in the joining (Gefüge) of which “der Riss sich fügt”

RM.content: rhetorical determination encounters its own possibility in the trait > trait not comprehended w/in set it makes possible
RM.linkedContent: rhetorical determination encounters its own possibility in the trait > trait not comprehended w/in set it makes possible

RM.content: retrait no more proper, literal, than figurative
RM.linkedContent: retrait no more proper, literal, than figurative

RM.content: retrait not confused w/ words it makes possible, including French/English words crossed or grafted here
RM.linkedContent: retrait not confused w/ words it makes possible, including French/English words crossed or grafted here

RM.content: retrait breaches/broaches/inscribes ontological difference itself
RM.linkedContent: retrait breaches/broaches/inscribes ontological difference itself

RM.content: retrait is plural, singularly plural [Nancy] in itself, divides itself, gathers up in withdrawal of withdrawal > elsewhere, Derrida called this pas
RM.linkedContent: retrait is plural, singularly plural [Nancy] in itself, divides itself, gathers up in withdrawal of withdrawal > elsewhere, Derrida called this pas

D.content: Derrida’s text: re-marks passage [in Soller’s], repeats square by closing angle, opens another surface of writing to-come: play w/ cardo, hinge, cardinal points; remarque d’angle: all lines broken
D.linkedContent: Derrida’s text: re-marks passage [in Soller’s], repeats square by closing angle, opens another surface of writing to-come: play w/ cardo, hinge, cardinal points; remarque d’angle: all lines broken

D.content: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing
D.linkedContent: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing

PPT.content: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance
PPT.linkedContent: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance

PPT.content: the “interest,” the revenue of the surplus value, remains untranslatable in idiom’s economic performance, in ellipses of its trait, the word by word or trait for trait in which it contracts
PPT.linkedContent: the “interest,” the revenue of the surplus value, remains untranslatable in idiom’s economic performance, in ellipses of its trait, the word by word or trait for trait in which it contracts

PPT.content: Riss: opens above gulf, holds together opposite edges [is Derrida’s trait the same?]
PPT.linkedContent: Riss: opens above gulf, holds together opposite edges [is Derrida’s trait the same?]

PPT.content: essential parasitizing opens every system to its outside, divides unity of the line (trait) purported to mark the system’s edges
PPT.linkedContent: essential parasitizing opens every system to its outside, divides unity of the line (trait) purported to mark the system’s edges

PPT.content: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints
PPT.linkedContent: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints

PPT.content: trait is never common, never even one, w/ & w/out itself, its divisibility founds texts, traces, remains
PPT.linkedContent: trait is never common, never even one, w/ & w/out itself, its divisibility founds texts, traces, remains

PPT.content: in [classical] discourses on painting, trait always determined as opposition-slash > what happens before difference becomes opposition? becoming always been a concept of determinate opposition
PPT.linkedContent: in [classical] discourses on painting, trait always determined as opposition-slash > what happens before difference becomes opposition? becoming always been a concept of determinate opposition

PPT.content: trait never appears, never itself—contracts in its retreat? marks the difference of form/content of the appearing
PPT.linkedContent: trait never appears, never itself—contracts in its retreat? marks the difference of form/content of the appearing

PPT.content: l’entame of the origin: opens, w/ trace, w/out initiating anything
PPT.linkedContent: l’entame of the origin: opens, w/ trace, w/out initiating anything

PPT.content: le trait il s’y attire et s’y passe, de lui-même: situated, situates, btwn visible edging (la bordure visible) and phantom in center—from which we fascinate
PPT.linkedContent: le trait il s’y attire et s’y passe, de lui-même: situated, situates, btwn visible edging (la bordure visible) and phantom in center—from which we fascinate

+R.content: trait for trait—each stands for all the others: by this fact, never chance left for equivalence
+R.linkedContent: trait for trait—each stands for all the others: by this fact, never chance left for equivalence

+R.content: rigor/joyous severity of trait, petrifying (médusante) impassivity of line > disjunction works on any equality, unhinges, interrupts, truncates > “integrity in dispersion”
+R.linkedContent: rigor/joyous severity of trait, petrifying (médusante) impassivity of line > disjunction works on any equality, unhinges, interrupts, truncates > “integrity in dispersion”

+R.content: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)
+R.linkedContent: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)

C.content: [re: 127 coffin drawings in drawers] glossary tire, tirer, tiroir, tirage [draw, to draw, drawer, drawing (attracting)] (also à la tire of the pickpocket), leads to that of idiomatic trait, to duction or even “ductus” > one recognizes a draftsman even before he signs his name
C.linkedContent: [re: 127 coffin drawings in drawers] glossary tire, tirer, tiroir, tirage [draw, to draw, drawer, drawing (attracting)] (also à la tire of the pickpocket), leads to that of idiomatic trait, to duction or even “ductus” > one recognizes a draftsman even before he signs his name

C.content: seduction/attraction of a drawer, seduce the haunting of a cenotaph
C.linkedContent: seduction/attraction of a drawer, seduce the haunting of a cenotaph

C.content: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche
C.linkedContent: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche

AD.content: God, one “who loves the stranger” excessively so, excess like the non-reciprocity decided in death, the trait or stroke, the hyphen (trait d’union) of adieu: beyond being, where he might not pardon me, or elect me
AD.linkedContent: God, one “who loves the stranger” excessively so, excess like the non-reciprocity decided in death, the trait or stroke, the hyphen (trait d’union) of adieu: beyond being, where he might not pardon me, or elect me

LG.content: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole
LG.linkedContent: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole

LG.content: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)
LG.linkedContent: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)

LG.content: trait common to classes should follow a code that determines belonging, an identifiable trait identical to itself > but, this trait qua mark always a priori remarkable
LG.linkedContent: trait common to classes should follow a code that determines belonging, an identifiable trait identical to itself > but, this trait qua mark always a priori remarkable

LG.content: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light
LG.linkedContent: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light

OG.content: trait permits imitation, donner lieu to art as mimesis, possibility of iteration, this life & death of art > technique & imitation: opens space of calculation (grammaticality, scientific intervals)
OG.linkedContent: trait permits imitation, donner lieu to art as mimesis, possibility of iteration, this life & death of art > technique & imitation: opens space of calculation (grammaticality, scientific intervals)

OG.content: trait is spacing itself, marks figures, works on surface of painting & time of music
OG.linkedContent: trait is spacing itself, marks figures, works on surface of painting & time of music

SPEC.content: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même
SPEC.linkedContent: to account/read the athetic, Derrida unsatisfied w/ dérive (drifting), too continuous/homogenous movement, travels away w/out saccade > prefers double bind, des effondrements de bord, la rive se partage en son trait même

SPEC.content: all these silences by which a trace works on a text, not indivisible simplicity of limes or marginal trait (S is P, “this has [not] been thought”)—rather: the non-thematized, implicit, mode of foreclosure, disavowal…
SPEC.linkedContent: all these silences by which a trace works on a text, not indivisible simplicity of limes or marginal trait (S is P, “this has [not] been thought”)—rather: the non-thematized, implicit, mode of foreclosure, disavowal…

SPEC.content: variation-of-the-trait-in-relation-to-the-object, not only the theme of Symposium but its performance, its condition
